main event: A military radar observation reported a bright white object in the sky over Midwest City, Oklahoma on July 20, 1958.
interesting points: The object was round and about 200 to 300 feet in diameter,The radar indicated it emitted heat waves and appeared to be spinning,The observation lasted for about 2-3 minutes,The initial conclusion was that the object was planet Jupiter,No additional sightings were reported in the area, raising questions about the reliability of the observation.
witness description: Captain 33rd Air Division, very reliable source
